skill.name: common-pitfalls
skill.description: Orchestrates pitfall prevention skills for common development issues. Auto-triggered during code review to check for TanStack Query, Drizzle ORM, Express API, React, WebSocket, blockchain RPC, and security pitfalls.
skill.summary: Orchestrates pitfall prevention skills for common development issues. Auto-triggered during code rev...
skill.author: BarisSozen

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based documentation skill with no code execution, no file access, no network calls, and no external dependencies. Contains only markdown documentation defining code review patterns and sub-skill orchestration logic.

content.value_statement: Code review often misses subtle bugs that cause production issues. This skill orchestrates specialized checks for TanStack Query, Drizzle ORM, Express, React, WebSocket, blockchain, and security patterns to catch issues before they ship.
actual_capabilities: Detects TanStack Query anti-patterns (keys, invalidation, v5 patterns)
Identifies Drizzle ORM schema and migration issues
Flags Express API route and status code errors
Catches React component mistakes, accessibility (forms, responsive)
Checks blockchain RPC, gas, and multicall patterns
limitations: Cannot execute code to verify runtime behavior
Cannot access external APIs or test services
Cannot modify code - only identifies potential issues
Does not replace thorough manual testing

use_cases.title: Review React and Query code
use_cases.description: Catch React component issues and TanStack Query patterns before committing

use_cases.title: Audit API and database code
use_cases.description: Identify Express route errors and Drizzle ORM schema problems

use_cases.title: Check blockchain patterns
use_cases.description: Review RPC calls, gas estimation, and security patterns

prompt_templates.title: Full code review
prompt_templates.prompt: Run common-pitfalls skill to check for issues across all code categories

prompt_templates.title: Database review
prompt_templates.prompt: Check for Drizzle ORM pitfalls in the new schema and migrations

prompt_templates.prompt: Audit Express API routes for status code and storage pattern issues

prompt_templates.title: Security scan
prompt_templates.prompt: Scan for session key handling, caching, and logging security issues

output: Found 3 TanStack Query issues: missing query key invalidation after mutations
2 Drizzle ORM warnings: types not exported for User and Transaction models
1 Express API issue: POST /users returns 200 instead of 201
No WebSocket, blockchain, or security issues detected

best_practices: Run before committing to catch issues early
Combine with full-review skill for comprehensive analysis
Use the quick reference checklist during manual review
anti_patterns: Skipping review and shipping directly to production
Ignoring findings without understanding the context
Using this skill instead of thorough testing

faq.question: Which tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Auto-triggers with full-review skill.

faq.question: What categories does it check?
faq.answer: TanStack Query, Drizzle ORM, Express API, React, WebSocket, blockchain RPC, and security.

faq.question: Does it modify my code?
faq.answer: No. It only identifies potential issues and reports findings. You must fix them manually.

faq.question: Is my code data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-only skill. Your code never leaves the conversation and is not stored.

faq.question: Why were issues missed?
faq.answer: The skill detects known patterns. Novel code, business logic errors, and runtime issues require testing.

faq.question: How is this different from linters?
faq.answer: Linters check syntax and style. This skill catches semantic patterns and architectural issues.
